Package ui.menu

Class Dialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableSection
        • ui.menu.Dialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrintHandler, Section, SelectableSection, SelectionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Game.GameFinishedDialog, Game.PauseMenu, Menu, MinimumSize.MinimumSizeDialog.Dialog, SocketPlayer.ServerPlayer.ConnectingMessage
    public class Dialog
extends DrawableSelectableSection
    Represents a bordered box with a section in the top and a row of buttons at the bottom.
    Represents a selectable section that can be drawn to the terminal window.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dialog

        public Dialog​(Section section,
              Button[] buttons,
              TerminalHandler terminalHandler,
              EscapeHandler escapeHandler,
              boolean enabled,
              ColouredChar filler,
              Colour borderColour,
              BackgroundColour borderBackgroundColour)
        Constructor for Dialog. Spread the buttons out at the bottom if there is room.
        Parameters:
        section - The section for the main area of the dialog.
        buttons - The buttons to show at the bottom of the dialog.
        terminalHandler - The TerminalHandler.
        escapeHandler - The escape handler.
        enabled - Boolean; true if the dialog is enabled for selection.
        filler - The filler character to use for the space around the buttons.
        borderColour - The foreground colour of the border.
        borderBackgroundColour - The background colour of the border.

    • Method Detail

      • getRow

        public void getRow​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                   int row,
                   int startCol,
                   int maxCols)
        Generates a single line of the section to be written to the terminal. In this case pass to the underlying bordered section.
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row of the section to generate.
        startCol - The column of the section to start at.
        maxCols - The max number of columns to draw.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Getter for number of rows. In this case pass to the underlying bordered section.
        Returns:
        The height of the section in characters.

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Getter for number of columns. In this case pass to the underlying bordered section.
        Returns:
        The width of the section in characters.

      • update

        public void update()
        Called before drawing the section. In this case pass to the underlying bordered section.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Section
        Overrides:
        update in class DrawableSection

      • unfocus

        protected void unfocus()
        Called whenever focus is lost (i.e. from moving to next selection). In this case pass to the underlying bordered section.
        Specified by:
        unfocus in class DrawableSelectableSection

      • select

        public KeyHandler select​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user selects this element. In this case pass to the underlying selectable grid.
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be a different key handler for e.g. entering text).

      • focus

        public KeyHandler focus​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when this element is focused. If no handler is defined or section is not enabled call parent's focus method. If no parent is defined return current key handler. In this case pass to the underlying selectable grid.
        Specified by:
        focus in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        focus in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (normally this element's movement selection handler).

      • getHandler

        public KeyHandler getHandler()
        Returns the underlying KeyHandler. In this case focus first. In this case pass to the underlying selectable grid.
        Specified by:
        getHandler in interface SelectableSection
        Overrides:
        getHandler in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler.

      • getGrid

        public SelectableGrid<SelectableSection,​BasicSectionComposer<SelectableSection>,​SelectableSection> getGrid()
        Getter for the underlying section grid.
        Returns:
        The underlying section grid.
